item.title: Comment on N&O Story Highlights Immigrants’ Generosity by Kelly
item.dc:creator: Kelly
item.description: Terrific pictures! So glad to see refugees, immigrants, and native-born North Carolinians working together to make the Triangle a great place to live!
item.content:encoded: Terrific pictures! So glad to see refugees, immigrants, and native-born North Carolinians working together to make the Triangle a great place to live!

item.title: Comment on Immigrants, Old and New, Work Together to Help Our Community by Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: What an amazing day - thanks for organizing it, Uniting NC. We need more examples like this for how people from different backgrounds can work together to improve our communities.
item.content:encoded: What an amazing day – thanks for organizing it, Uniting NC. We need more examples like this for how people from different backgrounds can work together to improve our communities.

item.title: Comment on International Festival! by Carlos C
item.dc:creator: Carlos C
item.description: It's a great event to see the ever increasing diversity in our state.
item.content:encoded: It’s a great event to see the ever increasing diversity in our state.

item.title: Comment on International Festival! by Ellen G
item.dc:creator: Ellen G
item.description: Loved the upbeat music, and the short stories that tell so much! Looks like a wonderful festival!
item.content:encoded: Loved the upbeat music, and the short stories that tell so much! Looks like a wonderful festival!

item.description: Great video! Loved seeing all those smiles.
item.content:encoded: Great video! Loved seeing all those smiles.

item.title: Comment on The billboards are here! by Billboards that promote respect, kindness and community. | Denver Coalition for Integration
item.dc:creator: Billboards that promote respect, kindness and community. | Denver Coalition for Integration
item.description: [...] Here’s what was said at their kick off celebration: “This holiday season, let’s heed the instructions in all faiths to welcome the stranger and to treat our neighbors with kindness and respect. Our neighbors aren’t who they used to be. Now, they may be people who speak different languages or were born in other countries. We live in a global society, and we have to learn to live together — to see ourselves as allies rather than enemies. We can all help each other through hard times, rather than sinking into blame and scapegoating.” The billboards are paid for through donations from 250 community members around North Carolina. For more information please go to http://unitingnc.org/2011/12/the-billboards-are-here/ [...]
item.content:encoded: [...] Here’s what was said at their kick off celebration: “This holiday season, let’s heed the instructions in all faiths to welcome the stranger and to treat our neighbors with kindness and respect. Our neighbors aren’t who they used to be. Now, they may be people who speak different languages or were born in other countries. We live in a global society, and we have to learn to live together — to see ourselves as allies rather than enemies. We can all help each other through hard times, rather than sinking into blame and scapegoating.”   The billboards are paid for through donations from 250 community members around North Carolina.  For more information please go to http://unitingnc.org/2011/12/the-billboards-are-here/ [...]
